com.appacitive.android.model
Class Appacitive

java.lang.Object
  com.appacitive.android.model.Appacitive

public class Appacitive
extends java.lang.Object

An Appacitive object is the entry point to use the Appacitive SDK. All the network requests are queued up here and sent to the remote service.

Author:
Sandeep Dhull

Method Detail

initializeAppacitive

public static void initializeAppacitive(Context context,
                                        java.lang.String apiKey,
                                        AppacitiveCallback callback)
Creates a shared object.

Parameters:
context - Handle To the context.
apiKey - Application API Key.
callback - Callback to the caller indication whether session is properly initialized or failed.

getInstance

public static Appacitive getInstance()
Returns the singleton instance of Appacitive. If instance is null, then session is not initialized.

Returns:
Returns the shared instance of Appacitive.

endSession

public static void endSession()
End the currently active session. Any further request to appacitive wont be successful afterwards.

getSessionId

public java.lang.String getSessionId()
Returns:
Returns the currently active session key.

isEnableDebugForEachRequest

public boolean isEnableDebugForEachRequest()
Returns:
Returns true if debugging is enabled for each request, otherwise returns false.

setEnableDebugForEachRequest

public void setEnableDebugForEachRequest(boolean enableDebugForEachRequest)
This method will enable/disable debugging each request made to appacitive hence.

Parameters:
enableDebugForEachRequest - Enable/Disable the Debugging for each request.

isEnableLiveEnvironment

public boolean isEnableLiveEnvironment()
Returns:
Return the current environment. True indicates that current environment is live, and false the current environment is sandbox.

setEnableLiveEnvironment

public void setEnableLiveEnvironment(boolean enableLiveEnvironment)
By default the environment is set to sandbox. To change the environment to live pass true as an argument.

Parameters:
enableLiveEnvironment - Enables/Disables live environment.

getEnvironment

public java.lang.String getEnvironment()
Returns "live" if the current environment is "live", otherwise returns "sandbox".

Returns:
Returns the current Environment.
